body: Typing: Dynamically typed. Use the Typing module to specify types.
Paradigm: Multi-paradigm: object-oriented, imperative, functional, procedural, reflective
Concurrency: Supports multi-threading and asynchronous programming with asyncio
Python Info.description: Provides general information about the Python programming language.

body: # To run this program, use: `python filename.py`
Python Entry Point.description: Creates the entry point of a Python application.

Python Mathematical Operators.description: Lists the mathematical operators in Python.

body: Python is a dynamically typed language.
Some common types in Python include:
- NoneType: Represents the absence of a value
- object: Base class for all Python classes
- class: Custom class defined by the user
- Exception: Base class for all exceptions
Python Types.description: Lists some common types in Python.

Python Date Type.description: The Python datetime type from the datetime module.

Python Date Now.description: Gets the current date and time in Python.

body: Any # Note: Python is dynamically typed. Use the Typing module to specify types.
# - Python is dynamically typed, so there is no explicit type declaration.
# - Variables are created when you first assign a value to them.
# - Variables can be reassigned to different types.
# - Python does not have direct equivalents to 'var', 'let', or 'const'.
# - Use descriptive variable names to improve code readability.
${1:my_var} = None  # Variable can be set to None.

Python Create Date Variable.description: Creates a date variable in Python.

Python For Loop.description: Creates a for loop that iterates through a set of numbers with the index in Python.

Python For...In Loop.description: Iterates over an iterable object in Python.

body: # In Python, functions can have arguments with default values.
Python Function Args.description: Creates a function with arguments in Python, including an argument with a default value.

body: # Function with arguments: def function_name(arg1, arg2, ...): ...
# Function with named arguments: def function_name(*, arg1=value1, arg2=value2, ...): ...
Python Function Syntax.description: Outlines the syntax for functions in Python.

Python Comment.description: Creates a single-line comment in Python.

Python Multi-Line Comment.description: Creates a multi-line comment in Python.

Python Try Except.description: Creates a try...except block in Python.
